alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Blaine; Custer; Roger Mills; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 01 at 7:42PM CDT until June 01 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN BLAINE, NORTHEASTERN BECKHAM, CUSTER, SOUTHEASTERN ROGER MILLS AND NORTHWESTERN WASHITA COUNTIES... At 742 PM CDT, Emergency management reported flooding, especially near and north of Clinton. Do not drive through flooded roadways. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Elk City, Weatherford, Clinton, Thomas, Arapaho, Hammon, Custer City, Butler, Foss, Strong City, Foss Reservoir, Moorewood and Stafford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 52 and 86. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Beckham; Blaine; Custer; Roger Mills; Washita
